request.description: Adds a bridge to a lock and retrieves a token which will be used to access the apis.

item.name: Connect
item.description: APIs called directly by the connect device or hosted by the connect device.

request.description: File should be the following JSON object: `{"ssid":"{{SSID}}","security":7, "key":"{{WiFiPSK}}"}` encrypted with AES128/CBC/PKCS7 with they key `675d30d06ec68cb5e9bf5d7a794fe51e`. Unsecure networks should use a WiFiPSK of empty string, and a security value of 0.
Connects a doorbell to a lock.
Connects a nestcam to a lock.
Gets notes left by your guests.
Notifies current user when the specified user interacts the specified lock.
Turn off notifications of a specified user's interactions with a specified lock.

Valid user types are:

* user
* superuser
Notifies current user when the specified user locks the specified lock.
Notifies current user when the specified user unlocks the specified lock.
Tell august the name of one of your guests.
Not sure what this does yet.
Checks to see if lock's firmware supports keypads.
Get Pin. It appears august generates pin codes on their webserver.
This is done when you reset a lock to factory default.
Assigns a lock to a door.
Use the passed in values to generate a packet encrypted with the lock's firmware key containing the half of the session key selected by the phone.
Decrypts the lock's repsonse to initiate comms packet. Response will contain the half of the session key which was selected by the lock.
Connects a nestcam to a lock.

item.name: Tell August all params have been set

request.description:
Logs actions performed on the lock.

Example actions:

* unlock
* lock
Send data about requests to the lock

Logs actions performed on the lock.

Example actions:

* unlock
* lock

item.name: Misc
item.description: APIs which are difficult to categorize, or have not yes been categorized.

request.description: This api has something to do with https://developer.apple.com/library/ios/documentation/NetworkingInternet/Conceptual/RemoteNotificationsPG/Chapters/ApplePushService.html but I have not drilled into it yet.
Checks to see if August wants user to view any documents.
